page.title: 15Dullar Farm
page.content: Dullar farm is a Queen Anne farmhouse{(early 18th century)}with 150 acres of land, comprising 100 acres arable, and 50 acres permanent pasture. Three men are employed - the owner, a tractor driver and a herdsman, plus casual labour when needed. The farmer expressed difficulties in{planning for future crops and {policy}because of interference and {insufficient stability with the {European common market regulations. With difficulties with{EEC milk {quotas}it is more profitable to graze horses both for private use and for breeding. Crumpets farm, Old farm and the Arabian stud in Sandy lane are three such establishments.
